intro: Dendromecon rigida subsp. rhamnoides, commonly known as the yellow tree mustard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial shrub that produces bright yellow flowers in early spring. The plant has woody stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard species. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas.
